Key Arguments: The legislation threatens free speech, which is a fundamental pillar of democracy.
The government should not have the power to control or propagandize information.
Censorship has not been necessary for Australians to thrive since the advent of the internet.
Suppressing free speech can lead to authoritarianism and tyranny.
Notable Quotes: Vitality of free speech is paramount and our human/civil right.
History has taught us that when free speech and opinion are suppressed or silenced, the foundations of democracy crumble, leaving room for authoritarianism and tyranny to take hold.
